<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: please mark as `awaiting-review` if it's ready for review
I hope this is superseded by #11768.
This is taken from Jovan's code, right?

```suggestion
def Lean.Expr.headName? : Expr ‚Üí Option Name
```
or maybe
```suggestion
def Lean.Expr.headConstName? : Expr ‚Üí Option Name
```
to match `Lean.Expr.constName?`
Can you add the return type here?

```suggestion
  mkSelectionPanelRPC insertUnfold
    "Use shift-click to select one constant that you want to unfold."
    "Unfold üîç" (onlyGoal := false) (onlyOne := true)
```
Is this unrelated to the "try this" framework? It's not immediately obvious to me that I'm expected to click on the `unfold foo` that appears.
Is there any reason to restrict to one expression?

```suggestion
/-- Rpc function for the unfold widget. -/
```
perhaps?

I'm also not sure what the good meta style should be here, I think this is the same as doing `e.getAppFn.constName?` (or even `e.getAppFun'.constName?` which is probably a good idea here, it ignores mdata). So, do we need a new def, and if we do should it be defined recursively like this or via the existing ones directly.
I have a vague feeling that reusing existing components would be better in some cases for code generation (smaller dlls, more chance that someone adds a fast `implemented_by` / `extern` and it helps you) but no actual data there.

pullRequest.title: feat: Unfold widget
